summary: Dr. Cherry Ng shares her expertise in radio astronomy, the search for extraterrestrial intelligence (SETI), and her involvement in the Square Kilometer Array (SKA) Observatory.

events_list.video_caption: The video features Dr. Cherry Ng, the co-president of the Cradle of Life group of science at the SKA Observatory, standing in front of a lush indoor plant. She is wearing a dark floral-patterned blouse and glasses. The setting appears to be a modern, well-lit indoor space with a staircase visible in the background. Throughout the video, Dr. Ng speaks about her work and experiences, with subtitles in Spanish providing translations of her words. The subtitles mention her affiliation with the Centre National de la Recherche Scientifique (CNRS), a small city south of Paris, and her research interests in pulsars, fast radio bursts, and SETI signal detection. She also discusses her role as a researcher, emphasizing that her work is 100% research and that she enjoys working with students, even though she doesn't have teaching obligations. The video maintains a consistent visual style, focusing on Dr. Ng's expressions and gestures as she communicates her insights.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a driving, electronic-infused instrumental with a steady beat and a somewhat dark mood. This music gradually fades as a female speaker begins to talk about her work at the CNRS in France, specifying that she works at an institute near Paris. She describes her main scientific interest as radio transients and SETI research, explaining that her job is 100% research-based, although she enjoys working with students. As she elaborates on her contributions to academic life, including her role as a co-chair in the SKA Science Working Group, the electronic instrumental music returns, signaling the end of her narration.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman wearing glasses and a floral-patterned shirt, standing in front of a backdrop of lush green plants and a staircase. She speaks about her scientific career, mentioning her interest in the Square Kilometre Array (SKA) project, which she describes as the most sensitive radio telescope ever built. The text on the screen reads, "Cuando empecé mi carrera científica, hace unos 14 años, como estudiante, ya había oído hablar sobre el Square Kilometre, el proyecto SKA y estaba deseando trabajar con el que será el radiotelescopio más sensible jamás construido. Y creo que el SKA es realmente increíble; porque es el mejor instrumento científico que tendremos." (When I started my scientific career, about 14 years ago, as a student, I had already heard about the Square Kilometre, the SKA project, and I was eager to work with the most sensitive radio telescope ever built. And I believe that SKA is really incredible; because it is the best scientific instrument we will have.) The scene transitions to a digital animation of the Earth with interconnected lines and a grid pattern, symbolizing the global nature of the SKA project. The text reads, "Es un proyecto multinacional que realmente une al mundo para construir algo que hará avanzar nuestro conocimiento del universo." (It is a multinational project that really unites the world to build something that will advance our knowledge of the universe.) The animation highlights the collaborative and scientific significance of the SKA project.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single female speaker passionately discussing her scientific career and involvement with the Square Kilometer Array (SKA) project. She expresses enthusiasm for the project, emphasizing its potential as the "best science instrument" and highlighting its international collaboration. No music or background sounds are audible.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman wearing glasses and a floral-patterned blouse, standing in front of a backdrop of lush green plants and a staircase. She appears to be speaking, as indicated by her mouth movements and hand gestures. Throughout the video, Spanish subtitles appear at the bottom of the screen, providing context to her speech. The subtitles translate to: "So when SKAO contacted me to co-chair the Cradle of Life working group in 2022, I didn't hesitate and accepted immediately. In 2023, I was also invited to join the Science and Engineering Advisory Committee (SEAC) of SKAO. We meet about three times a year to hear about the progress of SKAO and give our expert recommendations on this progress." The video concludes with a black screen displaying the text "Los objetivos del grupo de ciencia Cradle of Life (SKAO)" in white, which translates to "The objectives of the Cradle of Life Science Group (SKAO)." The setting is indoors, with natural light illuminating the scene, creating a calm and professional atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a female speaker excitedly sharing how she was contacted by the SKA to be the co-chair of the Cradle of Life Science Working Group in 2022 and immediately agreed. She continues, mentioning being invited to join the Science and Engineering Advisory Committee for the SKA in 2023. Throughout her speech, background music plays that is ambient, slow, and electronic.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman wearing glasses and a floral-patterned shirt, standing in front of a lush indoor plant and a staircase. She appears to be speaking, as indicated by her mouth movements and the presence of subtitles in Spanish. The subtitles translate to "I am interested in the search for the origins of life," followed by "and I am also interested in the search for life in the universe." The scene transitions to an image of Earth from space, with the text "For example, the Earth, how it formed and how life emerged on it," and then to a depiction of a star system with the text "or topics such as the physics and chemistry of young stars." The video returns to the woman, who continues speaking, with subtitles stating "as well as the search for extraterrestrial intelligence in some other place in the universe." The final frame shows her again, with subtitles reading "I see it as a platform to facilitate all this type of collaborations." The video maintains a consistent indoor setting with natural light and greenery, creating a calm and educational atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a female speaker discussing the "Cradle of Life" science working group of the SKA, highlighting its focus on the origin of life and broad topics like planet formation and the Earth. She speaks with a thoughtful, articulate tone. She then provides an example of how the Earth was formed and life emerged, as well as physics and chemistry of young stars, and the search for extraterrestrial intelligence. She continues, describing the science working group of "Cradle of Life" as a platform to facilitate collaborations.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman wearing glasses and a floral-patterned blouse, standing in front of a backdrop of green plants and a staircase. She speaks about the preparation of the SKA (Square Kilometre Array) White Book, which began ten years ago. The scene transitions to an aerial view of a construction site with a large, hexagonal structure labeled 'SKA0,' surrounded by a barren landscape. The text on the screen reads 'Se está progresando mucho,' indicating significant progress. The video then shows a large radio telescope being lifted by a crane, with the text 'Y creo que el grupo va a jugar de nuevo un papel fundamental,' suggesting the group's crucial role. The woman reappears, discussing the SKA's role in preparing scientists for its availability. The video concludes with a dark screen displaying 'Búsqueda de inteligencia extraterrestre (SETI),' which translates to 'Search for extraterrestrial intelligence (SETI),' indicating the project's focus on SETI research.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female speaker mentioning the Square Kilometer Array (SKA) white book preparation about 10 years ago.  She describes it as a major activity for the science working group and how the SKA is being built. She suggests that the science working group is playing a major role in preparing scientists for when the SKA becomes available. The speaker then states that one of her research interests is in SETI. This is accompanied by upbeat, electronic music in the background.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman wearing glasses and a floral-patterned shirt, standing in front of a lush green plant and a staircase, discussing the search for extraterrestrial intelligence (SETI). The text on the screen reads "SETI es la búsqueda de inteligencia extraterrestre," which translates to "SETI is the search for extraterrestrial intelligence." She explains that they look for technosignatures, which are advanced technological signals, and mentions that these could be from intelligent extraterrestrial life. The scene transitions to an animated depiction of a starry sky with a bright sun, where a molecular structure is shown alongside a graph, with the text "Es análogo al estudio de biomarcadores," meaning "It is analogous to the study of biomarkers." The video then shows a graphical representation of a planet with a spectrum of colors, indicating the presence of water, methane, helium, hydrogen, ammonia, and oxygen, with the text "donde buscamos líneas moleculares, como la del agua, que pueden ser un indicativo de vida," translating to "where we look for molecular lines, such as that of water, which can be an indicator of life." The video effectively combines visual elements and text to explain the concept of technosignatures and their significance in the search for extraterrestrial life.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female speaker defining SETI as the search for extraterrestrial intelligence, looking for "techno-signatures." She explains how this search is "analogous to the study of bio-signatures." The speaker continues, mentioning scientists seeking molecular lines, such as water, which might indicate life.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman wearing glasses and a floral-patterned shirt, standing in front of a backdrop of green plants and a staircase. She speaks about the SETI community and its reliance on private donors, highlighting the Breakthrough Listen foundation as a prime example. The scene transitions to a graphic with the text "BREAKTHROUGH LISTEN" and silhouettes of a cityscape, satellite, and various radio telescopes, explaining the foundation's goal to study a hundred nearby galaxies. A starry night sky image follows, with text about analyzing data from a billion nearby stars. The woman continues to speak, emphasizing the opportunities Breakthrough Listen provides for young people to enter the field, mentioning the use of the world's most sensitive radio telescopes, including the Very Large Array and MeerKat in South Africa. The video maintains a consistent indoor setting with natural light and greenery, creating a calm and informative atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a female speaker talking about the SETI community and its growth, attributing it to support from private donors, specifically the Breakthrough Listen Foundation. She highlights the foundation's goals, such as studying nearby galaxies and analyzing data from stars. The speaker emphasizes the opportunities the program offers to young people, funding research, and supporting observing programs using radio telescopes worldwide. A short musical interlude follows, featuring a repetitive, simple techno-style beat that creates an upbeat and energetic mood.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman wearing glasses and a floral-patterned blouse, standing in front of a backdrop of lush green plants and a staircase. She appears to be speaking, as indicated by her mouth movements and the presence of subtitles in Spanish. The subtitles translate to questions and statements about the search for technosignatures, emphasizing the use of radio emissions for communication and the relative ease of producing such signals. The woman gestures with her hands, suggesting she is explaining or emphasizing points. The scene transitions to an image of a large radio telescope against a backdrop of a fiery celestial body, with the text "SKAO" visible, indicating the Square Kilometre Array project. The video returns to the woman, who continues her discussion, with subtitles explaining the advantages of radio emissions for interstellar communication. The setting remains consistent, with the woman maintaining a professional demeanor throughout the video.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a female speaker explaining the reason for searching for a techno-signature mainly in the radio spectrum, mentioning the low production cost and the analogy to humans using radio telecommunications, suggesting "any extraterrestrial civilizations" might do the same.  She mentions the atmospheric transmissibility of radio waves and the cost-effectiveness compared to space satellites.

events_list.video_caption: The video opens with a breathtaking view of a starry night sky, showcasing a cluster of radio telescopes under the Milky Way. The text "¿Y qué buscamos en el espectro de radio?" (And what are we looking for in the radio spectrum?) appears, setting the theme of the exploration. The scene transitions to an indoor setting where a woman, dressed in a dark floral blouse, speaks in front of a backdrop of green plants and a staircase. She explains that the most likely signals to detect are narrowband signals, illustrated by a colorful chart detailing various radio frequencies and their applications, such as marine radio navigation and satellite communications. The woman continues to elaborate on the use of filters to focus on a small range of the electromagnetic spectrum, distinguishing narrowband signals from astrophysical signals, which are broader. She emphasizes the importance of signals with a width of a hertz, which vary in time and frequency, and likens the search to detecting telecommunications from an exoplanet. The video concludes with the woman discussing the differential acceleration of the exoplanet relative to Earth's movement, maintaining a consistent indoor setting with greenery throughout her explanation.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a single female speaker with an enthusiastic, academic tone. She describes that in the radio spectrum, they are looking for narrowband drifting signals because human telecommunication technologies use filters to concentrate information. She further explains that narrowband signals are distinguishable from astrophysical signals, which tend to be broadband, and expects the signals to be drifting in time and frequency due to different differential acceleration between exoplanets and Earth.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman wearing glasses and a floral-patterned blouse is seen speaking in front of a backdrop of lush green plants and a staircase. She appears to be explaining the concept of Radio Frequency Interference (RFI), a concern for radio astronomers. The text on the screen reads, "Si hablas con cualquier radioastrónomo, te dirá que siente pavor ante algo llamado RFI, la interferencia de radiofrecuencia." (If you talk to any radio astronomer, they will tell you that they are afraid of something called RFI, radio frequency interference). She continues to elaborate on the topic, gesturing with her hands to emphasize her points. The text changes to, "Se trata de señales generadas por la tecnología humana, como teléfonos, televisiones o satélites," (It is about signals generated by human technology, such as phones, televisions, or satellites), and then to, "que los astrónomos, por desgracia, recogen en sus datos de observación," (that astronomers, unfortunately, collect in their observation data). Finally, the text reads, "y que contaminan la señal de las estrellas, de las galaxias, que quieren observar, que es mucho más débil." (and that contaminate the signal of the stars, of the galaxies, that they want to observe, which is much weaker). The woman's expressions and gestures convey her passion and concern for the issue, while the serene indoor setting with plants adds a calming atmosphere to the discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single female speaker, who speaks with an informative tone, explaining that radio astronomers "will be dreading of this thing called RFI, which is radio frequency interference." She describes how signals generated by human technology like "phones, televisions, or satellites" contaminate the data and make it difficult to observe stars and galaxies. The audio quality is clear and focused on the speaker's voice.

events_list.video_caption: The video begins with a breathtaking view of a large white satellite dish set against a snowy mountainous landscape under a clear blue sky. The text "Cuando buscamos señales de SETI," (When we search for SETI signals) appears at the bottom, indicating the context of the scene. The camera then shifts to show a person in a red jacket walking near a large blue building with a satellite dish, accompanied by the text "básicamente estamos intentando detectar RFI proveniente del espacio." (basically we are trying to detect RFI from space). The scene transitions to a night view of a satellite dish under a starry sky, with the same text displayed, emphasizing the search for radio frequency interference (RFI) from space. The video then shows a group of satellite dishes in a desert-like environment, with the text "Interferencias de radiofrecuencia generadas por inteligencia extraterrestre." (Radio frequency interference generated by extraterrestrial intelligence) at the bottom, suggesting the focus on extraterrestrial signals. The scene shifts indoors to a woman in a patterned blouse speaking, with the text "Creo que el primer tipo de tecnomarcador que detectaremos," (I believe the first type of technomarker we will detect) displayed, indicating her discussion on technomarkers. The video continues with the woman elaborating on the topic, with the text "como expliqué antes, serán estas señales variables de banda estrecha." (as I explained before, these will be narrowband variable signals) appearing, followed by "Pero, lo que es más importante, debe ser una señal que se repita." (But, what is more important, it must be a repeating signal), highlighting the importance of repeating signals in the search for extraterrestrial intelligence. The video maintains a consistent indoor setting with green plants and a staircase in the background, providing a professional and informative atmosphere throughout.
events_list.audio_caption: A female speaker explains that when searching for "technosignatures," they are trying to "detect RFI from space," particularly that generated by extraterrestrial intelligence. She believes that the first type of technosignature to be detected will be "narrowband drifting signals," but, more importantly, it "must be a signal that repeats."

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman wearing glasses and a patterned blouse is seated in a well-lit indoor space, surrounded by lush green plants. She appears to be engaged in a discussion or presentation, gesturing with her hands as she speaks. The background features a staircase and a doorway, contributing to a modern and professional atmosphere. Throughout the video, Spanish subtitles appear at the bottom of the screen, providing translations of her speech. The subtitles discuss the challenges of detecting signals from extraterrestrial intelligence (SETI), emphasizing the need for extraordinary evidence and the importance of coordinating observations across multiple radio telescopes. The woman's expressions and gestures suggest she is passionately explaining the topic, aiming to convey the significance of SETI research and the scientific rigor required to validate any potential discoveries.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a female speaker discussing SETI signals, suggesting caution by saying, "You cannot just see it once and say that this is a SETI signal," explaining that extraordinary claims need extraordinary evidence, indicating the need for consistent confirmation through multiple observations in the same location to be certain of its validity. She suggests coordinating with multiple radio telescopes to increase confidence in the signal's authenticity. This segues into background music, an ambient, atmospheric electronic piece with a rhythmic quality, that continues until the end of the clip.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman wearing glasses and a dark floral-patterned blouse is seated in an indoor setting with a backdrop of lush green plants and a staircase. She appears to be engaged in a conversation or interview, as indicated by her expressive facial expressions and hand gestures. The text on the screen reads, "Creo que detectar tecnomarcadores será uno de los mayores descubrimientos científicos de nuestro tiempo," which translates to "I believe that detecting technomarkers will be one of the greatest scientific discoveries of our time." This suggests that the woman is discussing the significance of technomarkers in scientific research. The text changes to "Creo que cambiará por completo nuestra perspectiva como humanos," meaning "I believe it will completely change our perspective as humans," indicating her belief in the profound impact of this discovery on humanity. The setting is well-lit, creating a professional and serene atmosphere conducive to the discussion.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a female speaker stating that detecting a "techno signature" would be "one of the most important scientific discoveries of all time" and that it "will completely change our perspective as human". The speaker speaks with excitement.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a woman wearing glasses and a floral-patterned blouse, seated in an indoor setting with lush green plants in the background. She appears to be engaged in a conversation or presentation, as indicated by her facial expressions and gestures. Throughout the video, Spanish subtitles appear at the bottom of the screen, providing context to her speech. The subtitles translate to: "For a very long time, we have thought that we are the only life in the universe," "as the most advanced form of life," "If we detect extraterrestrial intelligence," "it is most likely that they are more advanced than us," "I believe that studying the fate of extraterrestrial intelligence," "will teach us a lot about our past," "and most importantly, our future." The video transitions to a dark screen with the text "Inversión en SETI" (Investment in SETI), indicating a shift in focus to the topic of investment in the Search for Extraterrestrial Intelligence (SETI). The setting remains consistent, with the woman continuing to speak, and the background featuring a staircase and a wooden door, contributing to a calm and professional atmosphere.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a female speaker in a thoughtful tone discussing extraterrestrial intelligence, suggesting that if discovered, they would likely be more advanced than humans, offering insights into our past and future. This spoken section is overlaid with synthwave music, creating an atmospheric mood with its electronic instrumentation and driving rhythm.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a woman wearing glasses and a floral-patterned blouse is seated in a well-lit indoor setting, surrounded by lush green plants. She appears to be engaged in a conversation, gesturing with her hands as she speaks. The background features a wooden door and a staircase, adding to the cozy atmosphere. Throughout the video, Spanish subtitles appear at the bottom of the screen, providing translations of her dialogue. The subtitles discuss the topic of extraterrestrial intelligence, with phrases like "Alguna gente dice que es un desperdicio de dinero buscar inteligencia extraterrestre" (Some people say that it is a waste of money to look for extraterrestrial intelligence) and "Creo que '¿Estamos solos?' es una de las preguntas más profundas que nos hacemos" (I believe that 'Are we alone?' is one of the deepest questions we ask ourselves). The woman's expressions and gestures suggest she is passionately sharing her thoughts on the subject, engaging the audience with her insights.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a woman speaking in an enthusiastic tone. She references an interesting discussion regarding the question of whether we could time travel to see the answer to one astronomy question. She states that many chose the question, "Is there life outside, and have we made contact?" She concludes that "are we alone" is a most profound question that captures the imagination of not only scientists, but also the general public.

events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a single female speaker discussing people who claim money spent on searching for alien life is a waste, because they don't think any signals will be detected soon. She expresses partial agreement, noting that only a tiny fraction of the sky has been searched for such signals. She suggests that current technology may not be sensitive enough to detect signals, but emphasizes the necessity of searching to have any chance of finding them. The speaker's tone is thoughtful and conversational.
